This is an Atom formatted XML site feed. It is intended to be viewed in a Newsreader. Alternatively you can view the HTML archives at https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/webadmin?A0=BNAC.
LISTSERV Web Interface 2.4.1 2015-03-04T10:00:15Z Krishna Adhikari 2015-03-04T09:59:58+00:00 2015-03-04T09:59:58+00:00 FW: Nurturing University Community Engagement | Integration, Innovation and Impact https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BNAC;8f9d21de.1503 Dear all, I have been asked by our member Sara Parker to advertise call for paper for the International Conference on \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdNurturing University Community Engagement: Integration, Innovation and Impact". For more information, please visit this link: http://nsswengage.org/ Kind regards Krishna Adhikari General Secretary BNAC bnac.ac.uk Krishna Adhikari 2015-02-28T13:57:53+00:00 2015-02-28T13:57:53+00:00 FW: News https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BNAC;cd979696.1502 Dear all,<br><br>It is our pleasure to share with you the news that Professor Surya Subedi, the founding Chairman of BNAC, has been appointed as a member of a Task Force on Investment Policy by by the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, and the International Centre for Trade and Sustainable Development in Geneva. If you would like to read the summary of the news, please find the following text Michael Hutt 2015-02-27T16:04:57+00:00 2015-02-27T16:04:57+00:00 Fwd: SOAS South Asia Institute: 2nd Annual Graduate Workshop on South Asia Cityscapes: Social, economic and cultural transformations @ SOAS, 8 June 2015 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BNAC;7d445829.1502 Dear colleague<br><br>My apologies: the deadline for offers of papers for this workshop was<br>originally 27 February but has been now put back to 20 March: this was<br>changed in the text headed 'registration', but not in the main heading of<br>the email we sent out on Wednesday. Please do encourage students who wish<br>to contribute but were put off by the original deadline to please send in<br>abstracts: they still have time! [...] Edwin Van Teijlingen 2015-02-25T19:33:03+00:00 2015-02-25T19:33:03+00:00 Fw: New publication from Social Science Baha https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BNAC;45e4d227.1502 Now available in Kathmandu bookstores<br><br>The Dynamics of Health in Nepal<br>Edited by Sharada Prasad Wasti, Padam Simkhada & Edwin van Teijlingen<br>2015, pp. xiv+240<br>ISBN: 978 9937 2 9095 1<br>Online orders can be placed here<http://himalbooks.com/shop/products/The-Dynamics-of-Health-in-Nepal.html>.<br>Nepal has experienced tremendous social, economic and political transformations in recent years. This is true of the health sector as well. But despite strong advances in the provision of services, health as an agenda for research has not been fully explored. This book is an attempt to highlight the developments that have taken place in different aspects of this sector and also to [...] Michael Hutt 2015-02-25T17:13:57+00:00 2015-02-25T17:13:57+00:00 SOAS South Asia Institute: 2nd Annual Graduate Workshop on South Asia Cityscapes: Social, economic and cultural transformations @ SOAS, 8 June 2015 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BNAC;f5b0d4d3.1502 SOAS South Asia Institute<br>Second Annual Graduate Workshop<br>*South Asia Cityscapes: Social, economic and cultural transformations *<br><br>*Date:* 8 June 2015*, *9:00am - 6.00pm<br><br>*Venue:* Meet 116, Russell Square Main Building, SOAS, University of London<br>Call for Papers - Deadline 27th February 2015<br><br>Urbanising processes are taking place across the South Asian region, the<br>home of more than a fifth of humanity. South Asian cityscapes are<br>consequently playing a significant role in shaping social, economic and<br>cultural formations. Arjun Appadurai\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds notion of \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdfive scapes\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd (or flows)<br>conceptualises the rapid processes by which ideas, information, people,<br>finances, and technologies are constantly [...] Bnac Studyday 2015-02-19T19:16:54+00:00 2015-02-19T19:16:54+00:00 2015 Nepal Study Day: final call https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BNAC;8b675c74.1502 BRITAIN-NEPAL ACADEMIC COUNCIL<br><br>Call for Papers for the 13th Nepal Study Day<br><br>Hosted by the South Asia Institute, SOAS University of London<br><br>16-17th April, 2015<br><br>The Britain Nepal Academic Council (BNAC) invites scholars and<br>practitioners from all disciplines to participate in the 13thBNAC Nepal<br>Study Days. All presentations should focus on Nepal, its diaspora and the<br>Nepali cultural world. The programme will talk place at<br>Bhetghat Restaurant, Aldershot. Attached is the flyer of the programme.<br>Hope you will be able to attend the programme. Please contact Dr Chandra<br>Laksamba <chandra.laksamba@cnsuk.org.uk> for more information. Papers can also be comparative so long as Nepal or the Himalaya is included in the comparison. [...] Michael Hutt 2014-12-03T11:04:56+00:00 2014-12-03T11:04:56+00:00 'The Crucible of Revolution: what it means to be a Nepali Maoist' talk by Bhaskar Gautam at SOAS 10 December https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BNAC;bf6915f8.1412 *Wednesday 10 December 2014*The Crucible of Revolution: what it means to be<br>a Nepali Maoist<br>Bhaskar Gautam (SSAI Visiting Fellow)<br>17:15-19:00<br>Room FG01, Ground Floor, Faber Building, Russell Square<br><br>*Abstract*Nepal in recent years has moved away from the fetishism of<br>constitutional monarchy and parliamentary democracy. Its political<br>discourses have shifted to urgent and grave question such as how to<br>redesign the polity so that it can embrace and promote diversity and<br>development with justice. This concern is at the very heart of the project<br>of radical democracy. Drawing on the intellectual history of the Maoist<br>Movement, Dr Gautam will discuss [...]
